refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: This file specifies configuration options for various components of the 3G Bridge suite.

The configuration file is organized into groups. Every group must start with the group name enclosed in square brackets. Inside a group there can be any number of key-value pairs specifying various options. Lines starting with a # are treated as comments and are ignored.

There are a number of sections, described below, that contain options for specific components of the 3G Bridge suite. If a group is not one of these, then it defines a target grid system where jobs can be sent.

The pre-defined group names are:
database: Database access parameters
defaults: Global defaults
bridge: Specific options for 3g-bridge
wssubmitter: Specific options for wssubmitter

refsect1.title: DATABASE ACCESS PARAMETERS
refsect1.para: The following values can be configured in the database group:

glossdef.para: The name of the MySQL database to use.
User name to use when connecting to the database. Defaults to the name of the current user.
The name of the host where the database is. Defaults to localhost.
Password for authenticating to the database.

Max. number of simultaneous database connections. Setting it too low may cause deadlocks; setting it high usually does not cause any harm. The 3g-bridge requires this limit to be at least 4; for the wssubmitter, it is recommended to set this limit to 1.5 times the number of download plus service threads.

refsect1.title: GLOBAL DEFAULTS
refsect1.para: The following values can be configured in the defaults group. The same values can also be listed in the bridge and wssubmitter groups, in this case the values specified there override the defaults.

glossdef.para: Specifies the minimum severity of a message to be logged. The value must be one of (in increasing severity order): debug, info, notice, warning, error and crit. The value is not case-sensitive.

Specifies where to send log messages. Possible values:
stdout: send all messages to the standard output.
syslog: send all messages to the system log. You can also specify the syslog facility after a colon, e.g.: syslog:user. The default facility is daemon.
file:FILE: write all messages to the specified FILE.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR 3G-BRIDGE
refsect1.para: The following values can be specified in the bridge group:

glossdef.para: Location of the pid file. When running as a daemon, the 3g-bridge stores its process ID in this file.
Time to sleep between polls of the database watching for new jobs.
Minimum time between status updates of the grid plugins.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR WSSUBMITTER
refsect1.para: The following values can be specified in the wssubmitter group:

glossdef.para: Location of the pid file. When running as a daemon, the wssubmitter stores its process ID in this file.
Network port where wssubmitter should listen on.
Number of threads to launch for servicing requests.
Number of threads to launch for downloading the input files of submitted jobs.
Directory where the input files of submitted jobs are stored.
Directory where to store the generated output files of finished jobs.

URL prefix for downloading the output files. When a remote client requests the list of output files for a specific job, wssubmitter replaces the value of output-dir in the file name with the value of output-url-prefix and reports the resulting URL. It is the responsibility of the system administrator to configure the appropriate web server such a way that the output files are really available at the resulting location.

refsect1.title: DEFINING GRID INSTANCES
refsect1.para: If the name of a group is not one of the values described above, then it defines a grid instance where jobs can be sent. The name of the group is matched with the grid name in the database to decide where to send a specific job.
Every grid definition group must contain a value for handler that decides which grid plugin will handle this definition. The group may also contain additional definitions specific to the grid plugin.
Currently the following grid plugins are available (i.e. these are the allowed values for handler), provided the support for the specified plugin is compiled into the 3g-bridge:

listitem.para: DC-API: Submit jobs using DC-API with batching support. The jobs must refer to applications that are using the genwrapper.
DC-API-SINGLE: Submit jobs using DC-API, without batching support. Any DC-API compatible applications can be submitted this way.
EGEE: Submit jobs to an EGEE VO using gLite.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR THE DC-API AND DC-API-SINGLE PLUGINS
refsect1.para: The DC-API and DC-API-SINGLE plugins handle job submission using DC-API. The DC-API plugin supports batching and requires that the application is specifically prepared for batching. The DC-API-SINGLE plugin supports any DC-API application.

glossdef.para: Location of the config file for the DC-API. If not specified, the DC-API default is used, which is dc-api.conf in the current directory. Note that when running as a daemon, the 3g-bridge switches to the root directory, so the default value will not work, and a file with an absolute path name must be specified here.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR THE EGEE PLUGIN
refsect1.para: The EGEE plugin handles job submission using gLite.

glossdef.para: URL of the WMS service.
Name of the VO (Virtual Organization) where the job should be sent.
Name of the host where MyProxy runs.
The port of the MyProxy server. Defaults to 7512.
User name used when authenticating to MyProxy.
X.509 certificate used for authenticating to MyProxy.
The private key for the certificate used for authenticating to MyProxy.
URL prefix for the input sandbox.

Directory prefix for the job log files. EGEE plugin places some EGEE-related logging information (e.g. status query, detailed logging information, etc.). Log files will be placed into this directory following the JOBID.log filename scheme.

Specifies the logging level to be used for files in joblogdir. 'none' means nothing should be logged, 'error' means error messages and related inspection information should be logged, 'all' means everything should be logged. This latter includes logging status changes and EGEE logging information printing.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR THE XTERMWEB PLUGIN
refsect1.para: The XTREMWEB plugin handles job submission to XtremWeb.

glossdef.para: Path and directory of the installed XtremWeb Client.
Enviroment parameter for XtremWeb client functions.
Name of XtremWeb handler.
Installed directory of XtremWeb bridge, where the 3g-bridge executable located.
Time in seconds to download results file for bridge, redefine it according to size of files, default value is 20 seconds. larger results files to download, more time to use.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR THE BOINC PLUGIN
refsect1.para: The BOINC plugin supports the monitoring of BOINC projects.

glossdef.para: The location of the project's root directory.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR THE JAVA PLUGIN
refsect1.para: The Java plugin is special as it is not a real plugin but rather an interface for writing plugins in Java. It has the following configuration options.

glossdef.para: The classpath needed for locating the plugin and its dependencies. The location of the JAR file that contains the hu.sztaki.lpds.G3Bridge package is always added.
Location of the Java Runtime Environment (JRE). Defaults to the value of the JAVA_HOME environment variable. The Java plugin searches for the libjvm.so library recursively inside this directory.

Mandatory. The name of the Java class that implements the plugin functionality. This class must be a descendant of hu.sztaki.lpds.G3Bridge.GridHandler, and it must have a constructor taking a single String argument (the name of the plugin instance).

refsect1.para: In addition to the items listed above you can also add configuration items specific to the plugin implementation here.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS FOR THE BES PLUGIN
refsect1.para: The BES (Basic Execution Service) plugin is based on the Java plugin and supports the usage of BES-compatible resources, such as UNICORE or ARC A-REX services. It has the following configuration options.

glossdef.para: The classpath needed for locating the BES plugin and its dependencies. The location of the JAR file that contains the hu.sztaki.lpds.G3Bridge package is always added. Besides this, all JAR files needed for a BES client have to be enumerated here.
Location of the Java Runtime Environment (JRE). Defaults to the value of the JAVA_HOME environment variable. The Java plugin searches for the libjvm.so library recursively inside this directory.
Mandatory. The name of the Java class that implements the BES plugin functionality. This class must be hu.sztaki.lpds.G3Bridge.plugin.BESHandler for a BES plugin.
The public address of the FTP server where BES resources can download input files from or can upload output files to.
The base directory of the FTP server available through ftpserver.address.
Boolean value indicating if anonymous FTP access should be used or not. A-REX resources support only this kind of FTP operation. Possible values are true and false.
In case of ftpserver.anonymous is false, this value contains the username to log in to the FTP server.
In case of ftpserver.anonymous is false, this value contains the password to log in to the FTP server.
This variable contains the URL of the BES service to be used by the plugin.
This variable contains the full path of the user key file to be used for connecting to the service in PKCS12 format.
This variable contains the password belonging to the user key specified in beswebservice.ssl.userkey.file.
This variable contains the path to the trusted CA keystore in JKS format.
This variable contains the password belonging to the truststore specified in beswebservice.ssl.truststore.file.
This boolean value indicates if a wrapper script should be created for each job. The only task of this wrapper script is to change the permissions of the executable before its execution.
This value contains the filename that should be used for creating wrapper scripts. The created wrapper script always receives the job's identifier as postfix.
This value contains the path where wrapper script should be created. This path must be within the ftpserver.basedir directory.
